data.title: Let’s See Some Of The Most Celebrated Olympians From Montana
data.meta_description: When it comes to the Olympic athletes from Montana, there might not be many of them, but plenty found success in their careers.
data.text:
These Are Some Of The Best Olympic Athletes From Montana

The 2024 Summer Olympics are underway right now in Paris, France.

This year, Montana has two athletes to represent America, joining a long history of Olympians from the Treasure State.

READ NEXT: World Cup 2026 Comes To America, Where Will The Games Be Played?

What Montana Athletes Made The Olympic Team For 2024

Both athletes are standing in some big shadows when it comes to the Olympics.

Katharine Berkoff, from Missoula, will be participating in the 100m backstroke. She is the daughter of David Berkoff, who participated in the 1988 and 1992 Olympics, winning two gold medals.

Ivan Roe, from Manhattan, is the second Montana athlete who will be in Paris, as he qualified for both the 10 meter air rifle and 50 meter smallbore in the shooting category.

READ MORE: The Best 15 Montana High Schools For Sports

Who Are The Best Olympians From Montana?

Montana might not have sent the most athletes to the Olympics over the years, but a few that we have sent have been some of the best to ever represent both Montana and America.

Some of the athletes you may be familiar with—we even had one go on to become the governor of Montana—there are also perhaps some unfamiliar names that we feel should be celebrated.
